term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - polarization error in spectrochemical analysis
term.title: polarization error

item.text: An error which arises from the fact that the absorbance of a sample (especially a solid) could depend on the polarization of the incident radiation and from the polarization dependent response of the photodetector.

sources.item: PAC, 1988, 60, 1449. 'Nomenclature, symbols, units and their usage in spectrochemical analysis - VII. Molecular absorption spectroscopy, ultraviolet and visible (UV/VIS) (Recommendations 1988)' on page 1456 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198860091449)
